noun.description: A mammal of an order whose members are born incompletely developed and are typically carried and suckled in a pouch on the mother's belly. Marsupials are found mainly in Australia and New Guinea, although three families, including the opossums, live in America.

origin: Late 17th century (in the sense resembling a pouch): from modern Latin marsupialis, via Latin from Greek marsupion pouch (see marsupium).
